sentences.text: To Our Shareholders
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Throughout 2016, the Board of Directors continued to make significant enhancements to Expeditors governance and executive compensation programs.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The feedback we gathered through extensive dialog with our shareholders told  us that more change was needed to bring our compensation programs even more in line with current best practices.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This proxy discusses those changes, as well as our 2017 Omnibus Incentive Plan, which we ask you to support.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Most notably, enhancements to Chief Executive Officer (CEO) compensation in 2017 include:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Increasing the long term incentive equity incentive component of total compensation;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Adding a 5% operating income growth requirement to achieve full payout of the annual cash incentive; and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Adopting PSU (performance share units) metrics that vest only if certain 3-year performance goals are achieved.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition to adopting PSUs as an integral component of CEO compensation, the Board is recommending  replacing stock options with RSUs (restricted stock units) across the Company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Just as many companies have  switched to RSUs in recent years, we believe that the adoption of RSUs will be helpful in continuing to attract  and retain talent in the years ahead.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In early 2017, the Company established for the first time a Chief Strategy Officer role by appointing a long- tenured, highly successful executive.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We are partially funding this new function by re-allocating a portion  of the executive incentive compensation pool from existing senior management, including NEO, to this new  strategic group.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We continued to advance our multi-year Board refreshment plan and this year we name two highly seasoned  Directors to the slate:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Glenn Alger has deep logistics knowledge and experience as one of Expeditors founders, who helped  grow the Company from 20 people and six offices into a global force in the logistics industry.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Alain Moni has broad international leadership experience as CEO of one of the worlds leading technology  distribution companies, which, until the end of 2016, was a publicly traded, Fortune 500 company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We say thank you to two departing Board members and friends.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mike Malone has provided us with sound  business wisdom and acumen for the past 17 years.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: James Wangs service to the Company goes back to its  earliest days, as one of our founders and as a member of the Board for the past 28 years.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As highly dedicated  Directors and as fine individuals, they will both be missed.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: At this years meeting, you will be asked to vote FOR five proposals put forth by the Board, and to vote  AGAINST one shareholder proposal.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our Boards recommendations in this proxy are made only after careful  deliberation of the best interests of our Company, shareholders and employees and prior voting results.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: On behalf of the entire Board of Directors and 16,000 employees of Expeditors, we want to thank you for your  continued support and investment in our business.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Sincerely,
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Robert R. Wright Chairman of the Board
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: PROXY SUMMARY
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Compensation Philosophy
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our company is committed to a strong pay for performance compensation philosophy that is a foundational  characteristic of our companys culture.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Expeditors has been and will continue to be driven by company  performance and doing what is right for our shareholders, our customers and our employees.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: While we have  planned changes to our CEO compensation, the core compensation structure, which has been in place since  the Company became publicly traded, is responsible for differentiating the Companys performance from that  of many of our competitors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The objective of our core compensation program is to enhance shareholder value over the long term by
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: encouraging each manager to think and act as an entrepreneur;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: establishing compensation levels that are not perceived as arbitrary;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: providing financial rewards that are team-oriented and reflect achieved performance; and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: aligning the interests of the individual employee with the goals of the Company and returns to our shareholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our core compensation programs directly serve the interests of our shareholders through:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Supporting a culture that results in low turnover and long tenured employees who look to make a  career at Expeditors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Low turnover substantially reduces our cost to recruit and train new hires.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Long- tenured employees and managers provide a strong and growing bench strength.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This is evidenced by  the long tenure of our top managers: our CEO has been with the Company for 34 years and our other  Named Executive Officers (NEO) average tenure with the Company is 26 years.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Rewarding management for achieved performance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our core Executive Incentive Compensation  Plan will deliver compensation only if we have positive operating income.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The level of incentive  compensation paid is directly correlated to performance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Future increases in incentive compensation payouts are dependent upon managements ability to increase our operating income year over year.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Increasing value over the long term.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our heavy emphasis on operating income is due to its strong  correlation to enterprise value creation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For example, during the 10-year time period ended December  31, 2016, annual earnings per share has increased from $1.21 to $2.36 and our dividend has increased  from $0.28 to $0.80.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Responding to Shareholders
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We value our shareholders view on compensation and recognize that 68% of shareholders supported our Say  on Pay proposal in 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We continued to engage with shareholders representing more than 100 million shares  or approximately 60% of the outstanding shares of the company to understand their perspectives on our pay  programs.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Partly as a result of these conversations, the Compensation Committee adopted certain changes to  the compensation program that are intended to balance our existing compensation philosophy with evolving  pay practices, shareholders perspectives and shareholder alignment.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: After much discussion and analysis, four substantial changes will be implemented to CEO compensation in 2017:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Shifting a greater portion of CEO pay from cash to long-term equity incentives in order to further  enhance shareholder alignment and multi-year performance;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Notice of Annual Meeting & Proxy Statement|5
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: PROXY SUMMARY
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Reducing the CEOs allocation of the Executive Incentive Compensation Pool by 6% to help fund  expansion of the Companys strategic growth initiatives;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Adding a minimum 5% operating income growth requirement for our CEO to realize full payout under the Executive Incentive Compensation Plan; and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Shifting a portion of CEO pay from annual to longer-term by adopting performance metrics in the  form of performance share units (PSU) that will vest only if 3-year performance goals are achieved  for Net Revenue and EPS.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: CEO Compensation
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For the CEOs compensation, illustrated in the charts below, we demonstrate our commitment to a pay for  performance compensation philosophy by delivering over 98% through incentive and at risk pay.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The two  charts further show the evolution of CEO compensation from 2016 to 2017, as more compensation comes from  equity, some triggered by performance against specific metrics, as described further in this document.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Cash  incentive is based on achievement of operating income as determined under generally accepted accounting  principles in the United States (U.S. GAAP), and starting in 2017, operating income must grow by 5% in order to earn full payout, further described in this document.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Cash Incentive Base Salary Equity Incentive
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 6|Expeditors International of Washington, Inc.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: PROXY SUMMARY
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Substantive Changes to 2017 Compensation
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We believe the following changes for 2017 further demonstrate our responsiveness to shareholders, while also  recognizing the competitive advantage we believe our current compensation program brings to our company  and shareholders:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Action Rationale Shifting a greater portion of CEO pay to equity   Increases CEO alignment with long-term interest of shareholders   Equity will represent approximately 40% of CEOs 2017 total pay  (defined as base salary plus cash incentive plus the targeted  value of RSU and PSU compared to approximately 24% of CEOs  2016 total pay) Adopting a performance share unit (PSU)  program for the CEO that will vest only if 3-year  performance goals are achieved for Net Revenue  and EPS   Provides performance-vesting LTI to align focus on long-term  performance   Aligns CEO with shareholders through share ownership  (provided PSUs are earned)   Aligns with prevalent market practices Adopting double trigger vesting upon a change- in-control for all new equity incentive awards  beginning in 2017   Aligns with emerging market practices and shareholder  preferences Replacing stock options with restricted stock  units (RSUs) for all NEO   Increases shareholder alignment of NEO   Supports leadership continuity Adding a performance requirement to CEOs  annual Executive Incentive Compensation Plan  requiring 5% year-over-year operating income  growth to earn unreduced payout (in lieu of 115%  payout cap that previously governed growth in  year-over-year payouts)   Establishes performance expectation for continuous profit  growth where if year-over-year operating income growth is less  than 5%, the executive receives a 5% reduction on their payout   Establishes minimum level of operating income performance  without penalizing for exceptional operating income growth Adopting a hold until met policy that requires  executives to hold 75% of the net after-tax shares  received upon vesting of PSUs and RSUs until their  respective stock ownership guidelines are met   Aligns executives with long-term interest of shareholders   Aligns with emerging market practices and shareholder  preferences
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Governance Highlights
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The 2017 Board slate reflects a multi-year Board succession plan that has secured expertise that maps to  Expeditors strategic direction, has reduced Director tenure, and has enhanced Board diversity.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Over the past  three years, the Boards composition has evolved substantially.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: During that time, we increased the percentage  of independent Directors (from 64% in 2013 to 82% in 2017), decreased the average tenure (from 12 years in 2013 to 5 years in 2017), and increased the percentage of women on the Board (from 9% in 2013 to 18% in 2017).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: To  further strengthen our Board, for 2017 we have nominated the following two candidates to the Directors slate:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Glenn Alger for his extensive industry and international experience; and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Alain Moni for his extensive international and leadership experience.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, we acted upon the 2016 shareholder vote and amended our Bylaws to implement proxy access on  the terms approved by shareholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Companys Bylaws require a Board of Directors composed of not less than 6 nor more than 11 members.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Expeditors Directors are elected at each Annual Meeting to hold office until the next Annual Meeting or until  the election or qualification of his or her successor.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Any vacancy resulting from the non-election of a Director  may be filled by the Board of Directors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board of Directors has unanimously approved the nominees  named below.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: All nominees other than Mr. Alger and Mr. Moni are members of the current Board of Directors.

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This years nominees consist of nine independent Directors and two non-independent Directors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Unless  otherwise instructed, it is the intention of the persons named in the accompanying form of proxy to vote  shares represented by properly executed proxies for the 11 nominees of the Board of Directors named below.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Although the Board anticipates that all of the nominees will be available to serve as Directors of the Company,  should any one or more of them be unwilling or unable to serve, it is intended that the proxies will be voted for  the election of a substitute nominee or nominees designated by the Board of Directors or the seat will remain  open until the Board of Directors identifies a nominee.

sentences.text: The following persons are nominated to serve as Directors until the Companys 2018 Annual Meeting of  Shareholders:

sentences.text: ROBERT R. WRIGHT

sentences.text: Robert R. Wright became a Director of the Company in May 2008, served as Lead Director from May 2010 and was appointed  Chairman of the Board in May 2014.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Since 2002, Mr. Wright has been the President and Chief Executive Officer of Matthew  G. Norton Co., a real estate investment, development and management firm based in Seattle, Washington.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Prior to joining  Matthew G. Norton, Mr. Wright was a Regional Managing Partner of Tax for Arthur Andersen.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: He currently serves on the Board of Directors for two privately held companies, Matthew G. Norton Co. and Stimson  Lumber Company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Over 20 years of senior leadership and management in private industry and the public accounting environment.

sentences.text: Expertise in tax, finance and real estate, succession planning and business operations.

sentences.text: Prior roles included leading business  and operational development in the Americas region and management and evolution of the Companys global products and  services.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Since his retirement from the Company in 2007, Mr. Alger has been principally engaged as an active investor and manager  of his family trust and charitable activities.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In 2015 and 2016, Mr. Alger provided consulting services to the Company.

sentences.text: As a founder,  former senior executive of the Company and a long-term shareholder, Mr. Alger brings a deep understanding of both Company  operations specifically and the logistics industry generally.

sentences.text: Director Identification & Nomination Process
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Policy on Director Nominations, which can be found on the Companys website at  www.investor.expeditors.com, describes the process by which Director nominees are selected by the  Nominating and Corporate Governance Committee, and includes the criteria the Committee will consider  in determining the qualifications of any candidate for Director.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In reviewing candidates for the Board, the  Committee considers the entirety of each candidates credentials in the context of these standards.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: With  respect to the nomination of continuing Directors for re-election, the individuals contributions to the Board  are also considered.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee annually reviews its nomination procedures to assess the effectiveness of the Policy on Director  Nominations.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee considers candidates for Director who are recommended by its members,  by  management, and by search firms retained by the Committee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, per the Policy on Director  Nominations, the Committee will also consider any candidate proposed by a shareholder satisfying certain notice  provisions, and will take into account the size and duration of the recommending shareholders ownership.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: All candidates for Director who, after evaluation, are then recommended by the Committee and approved  by the Board of Directors will be included in the Companys recommended slate of Director nominees in its  Proxy Statement.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, any shareholder or group of up to 20 shareholders that has continuously beneficially owned at  least 3% of the Companys Common Stock for at least three years, and who satisfies certain notice, information and consent provisions, may nominate up to 20% of the Directors standing for election and include such  nominees on the Companys proxy statement pursuant to the Companys proxy access rights.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Lastly, a  shareholder may nominate a Director candidate for election outside of the Companys proxy statement if  the shareholder complies with the notice, information and consent provisions of Article II of the Companys  Bylaws, which can be found on our website at www.investor.expeditors.com.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our Bylaws require any notice for director nominees for shareholder consideration be submitted by certain  deadlines, which are explained in detail under the heading Deadlines for Shareholder Proposals for the 2018  Annual Meeting of Shareholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Majority Vote Standard for Director Elections
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Companys Bylaws require that in an uncontested election each Director will be elected by the vote of the  majority of the votes cast.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A majority of votes cast means that the number of shares cast for a Directors  election exceeds the number of votes cast against that Director.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A share that is otherwise present at the  meeting but for which there is an abstention, or to which a shareholder gives no authority or direction, shall  not be considered a vote cast.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In an uncontested election, a nominee who does not receive a majority of the votes cast will not be elected.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: An  incumbent Director who is not elected because he or she does not receive a majority vote will continue to serve  as a holdover Director until the earliest of:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (a) 90 days after the date on which an inspector determines the voting  results as to that Director;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (b) the date on which the Board of Directors appoints an individual to fill the position  held by that Director; or
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (c) the date of the Directors resignation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Under the Companys resignation policy, any  Director who does not receive a majority vote in an uncontested election will resign immediately.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board may fill any vacancy resulting from the non-election of a Director as provided in the Companys  Bylaws.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Nominating and Corporate Governance Committee will consider promptly whether to fill the  position of a nominee who fails to receive a majority vote in an uncontested election and may make a  recommendation to the Board of Directors about filling the position.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board will act on the Committees  recommendation and within 90 days after the certification of the shareholder vote will disclose publicly  its decision.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Except as provided in the next sentence, no Director who fails to receive a majority vote for  election will participate in the Committee recommendation or Board decision about filling his or her office.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If no Director receives a majority vote in an uncontested election, then the incumbent Directors:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (a) will  nominate a slate of Directors and hold a special meeting for the purpose of electing those nominees as soon as practicable; and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (b) may in the interim fill one or more positions with the same Director(s) who will continue in  office until their successors are elected.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: CORPORATE GOVERNANCE
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Board Operations
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board of Directors has policies and procedures to ensure effective operations and governance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our corporate  governance materials, including our Corporate Governance Principles, the Charters of each of the Boards  Committees and our Code of Business Conduct, can be found on our website at www.investor.expeditors.com.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In 2016, the Board was composed of nine independent Directors and two non-independent Directors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Wright  serves as the independent Chairman of the Board of Directors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The primary functions of Expeditors Board of  Directors include:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Ensuring that the long-term interests of shareholders are being served;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Assuring that Board discussions focus on forward-looking strategies, approving such strategies and  monitoring related performance;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Overseeing the conduct of our business and monitoring significant enterprise risks;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Overseeing our processes for maintaining the integrity of our financial statements and other public disclosures, and compliance with laws and ethical conduct;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Evaluating CEO and senior management performance and determining executive compensation;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Planning CEO succession and monitoring managements succession planning for other key executive officers; and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Establishing tone at the top, effective governance structure, including appropriate Board evaluation,  composition and planning for Board succession.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board of Directors has determined that all current Directors except Messrs. Musser and Wang, and all  Director nominees except Messrs. Musser and Alger, are independent under the applicable independence  standards set forth in the rules promulgated under the Securities Exchange Act of 1934, as amended  (Exchange Act) and the rules of the NASDAQ Stock Market.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board has designated that only independent  Directors can serve as Committee members.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board currently has the following Committees: Nominating and Corporate Governance, Compensation  and Audit.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Each Committee operates under a written charter, all of which are available on our website  www.investor.expeditors.com.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 14|Expeditors International of Washington, Inc.

sentences.text: CORPORATE GOVERNANCE
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Board Practices & Procedures
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Boards Committees analyze and review the Companys activities in key areas such as financial  reporting, internal controls over financial reporting, compliance with Company policies, corporate  governance, significant risks, succession planning and executive compensation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board and its Committee Chairs review the agendas and matters to be considered in advance of  each meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Each Board and Committee member is free to raise matters that are not on the agenda  at any meeting and to suggest items for inclusion on future agendas.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Each Director is provided in advance with materials to be considered at every meeting of the Board  and Committees and has the opportunity to provide comments and suggestions.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board and its Committees provide feedback to management and management answers questions raised by the Directors during Board and Committee meetings.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Independent Board and Committee members meet separately at each Board and Committee meeting  and as otherwise needed.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Independent Directors regularly hold executive sessions without management.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Board Attendance
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board met five times in 2016 and each Director attended at least 75% of the total number of Board of  Directors meetings and Committee meetings on which they served.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: While the Company has no established  policy requiring Directors to attend the Annual Meeting, all members attended the 2016 Annual Meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Director Retirement Policy
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In 2015, the Board established a Director policy, whereby an individual Director will not be nominated to stand  for election to the Board of Directors at the next Annual Meeting if the Director has reached an age of 72 years.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In May 2017, Michael J. Malone will retire from the Board of Directors after 17 years of service.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, on  November 8, 2016, James L.K. Wang announced that he will not stand for re-election to the Board of Directors in  2017, after 28 years of service.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Boards Role in Risk Oversight
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Senior management is responsible for the assessment and day-to-day management of risk and brings to  the attention of the Board the material risks to the Company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board provides oversight and guidance to  management regarding the material risks.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Oversight responsibilities for certain areas of risk are assigned to the  Boards three standing Committees and others are assigned to the full Board.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board and its Committees  regularly discuss with management the Companys strategies, operations, compliance, policies and inherent  associated risks in order to assess appropriate levels of risk taking and steps taken to monitor, mitigate and  control such exposures.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board believes the Companys risk management processes are appropriate  and that the active oversight role played by the Board and its Committees provides the appropriate level of  oversight for the Company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: PROPOSAL NO. 2: ADVISORY VOTE TO APPROVE
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: NAMED EXECUTIVE OFFICER COMPENSATON
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board has recommended four substantial changes to the CEOs 2017 compensation plan
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 1. Shifting a greater portion of CEO pay from cash to long-term equity incentives in order to further enhance shareholder alignment and multi-year performance;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Reducing the CEOs allocation of the Executive Incentive Compensation Pool by 6% to help fund  expansion of the Companys strategic growth initiatives;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 3. Adding a minimum 5% operating income growth requirement for our CEO to realize full bonus payout  under the Executive Incentive Compensation Plan; and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Shifting a portion of CEO pay from annual to longer-term by adopting performance metrics in the  form of performance share units (PSU) that will vest only if 3-year performance goals are achieved  for Net Revenue and EPS.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Substantive Changes to 2017 Compensation
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Action Rationale Shifting a greater portion of CEO pay to equity   Increases CEO alignment with long-term interest of shareholders   Equity will represent approximately 40% of CEOs 2017 total pay  (defined as base salary plus cash incentive plus the targeted  value of RSU and PSU compared to approximately 24% of CEOs  2016 total pay) Adopting a performance share unit (PSU)  program for the CEO that will vest only if 3-year  performance goals are achieved for Net Revenue  and EPS   Provides performance-vesting LTI to align focus on long-term  performance   Aligns CEO with shareholders through share ownership  (provided PSUs are earned)   Aligns with prevalent market practices Adopting double trigger vesting upon a change- in-control for all new equity incentive awards  beginning in 2017   Aligns with emerging market practices and shareholder  preferences Replacing stock options with restricted stock  units (RSUs) for all NEO   Increases shareholder alignment of NEO   Supports leadership continuity Adding a performance requirement to CEOs  annual Executive Incentive Compensation Plan  requiring 5% year-over-year operating income  growth to earn unreduced payout (in lieu of 115%  payout cap that previously governed growth in  year-over-year payouts)   Establishes performance expectation for continuous profit  growth where if year-over-year operating income growth is less  than 5%, the executive receives a 5% reduction on their payout   Establishes minimum level of operating income performance  without penalizing for exceptional operating income growth Adopting a hold until met policy that requires  executives to hold 75% of the net after-tax shares  received upon vesting of PSUs and RSUs until their  respective stock ownership guidelines are met   Aligns executives with long-term interest of shareholders   Aligns with emerging market practices and shareholder  preferences
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 24|Expeditors International of Washington, Inc.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: PROPOSAL NO. 2: ADVISORY VOTE TO APPROVE NAMED EXECUTIVE OFFICER COMPENSATON
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Compensation: What We Do and Dont Do
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: What We Do What We Dont Do Pay decisions are made by independent Directors No guaranteed bonuses Pay for performance  (over 98% of CEO pay is at risk and directly linked to performance) No perquisites Focus on multiple performance metrics (beginning in 2017) No supplemental pension benefits Double trigger vesting of unvested equity upon a change in control  (beginning in 2017) No repricing of underwater options Work with an independent compensation consultant No hedging or pledging of Company shares Align with shareholders through PSUs and RSUs (beginning in 2017) No tax gross-ups paid on severance benefits Maintain executive and outside Director share ownership guidelines No retirement bonuses Subject incentive compensation to clawback policy Engage shareholders on compensation matters Annual say-on-pay votes for our shareholders
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board of Directors has elected to submit the non-binding vote on compensation of the Companys NEO to shareholders on an annual basis.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: At the 2016 Annual Meeting, approximately 68% of shareholders supported the non-binding vote to approve  NEO compensation (say-on-pay).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee considered these voting results and  discussions with about 60% of our shareholders to shape the 2017 compensation program.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: EFFECT OF PROPOSAL
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This say-on-pay proposal is non-binding on the Board of Directors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The approval or disapproval of this  proposal by shareholders will not require the Board of Directors or the Compensation Committee to take  any action regarding NEO compensation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The final decision on NEO compensation remains with the Board  of Directors and/or its Compensation Committee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Although non-binding, the Board of Directors and the  Compensation Committee will review and consider the voting results when making future decisions regarding  NEO compensation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board of Directors recommends a vote FOR this proposal.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Notice of Annual Meeting & Proxy Statement|25
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: COMPENSATION DISCUSSION & ANALYSIS
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This Compensation Discussion and Analysis (CD&A) describes the Companys executive compensation  program in 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In particular, this CD&A explains how the Compensation Committee (the Committee) of the  Board of Directors made its compensation decisions for the Companys executives, including the following NEO:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Jeffrey S. Musser, President and Chief Executive Officer
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Philip M. Coughlin, President-Global Geographies & Operation
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Eugene K. Alger, President-Global Services
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Daniel R. Wall, President-Global Products
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Bradley S. Powell, Senior Vice President and Chief Financial Officer
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Base Salaries
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Throughout our history, we have followed a policy of offering our management employees a compensation  package that is heavily weighted toward incentive-based compensation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: To emphasize at-risk variable pay, we  have customarily set annual base salaries of our NEO and other top managers well below competitive market  levels.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our NEO 2016 base salaries were well below median NEO base salaries in our peer group.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In 2016, we set  base salaries for NEO at $100,000.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Executive Incentive Compensation Plan
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Executive Incentive Compensation Plan is the primary component of our compensation program.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Plan  has been in place since 1985 and its unique design incentivizes our management team to continually increase our  operating income, which in turn drives long-term shareholder value.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Executive Incentive Compensation Plan  is designed to drive superior financial results and is effective because of its simplicity, transparency, and focus on  a key operating metric.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Operating income captures many elements of managing a healthy business, including:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: growing and maintaining profitable business
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: gaining new customers
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: improving customer satisfaction
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: managing carriers and service provider relationships and costs
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: increasing employee satisfaction and retention
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: controlling expenses
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: collecting cash timely
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: To be successful, management must optimize the multiple elements of a full income statement, culminating with  operating income.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This metric is comprehensive, simple, objective and easily understood.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: It reflects short- and  long-term growth and efficiency, and creates a prudent and entrepreneurial environment.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We remain committed  to our focus on operating income and our view that this broad-based metric is a key driver of shareholder value  over the long-term.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 26|Expeditors International of Washington, Inc.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: COMPENSATION DISCUSSION & ANALYSIS
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our use of U.S. GAAP operating income rewards management for delivering profitable results.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We use U.S.  GAAP operating income because we believe that management must be held accountable for our results  regardless of external market forces that may adversely affect the level of bonus payouts.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our Executive  Incentive Compensation Plan creates a culture of shared economic interests among our top managers and  ensures a universal and daily focus on the achievement of superior financial results.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Equally important, our focus  on continual improvement in operating income drives long-term shareholder value creation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Described below are the key terms of the Plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: ELIGIBILITY FOR THE INCENTIVE POOL
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee, at its discretion, determined which executive officers and other top managers  would be eligible to participate in the Executive Incentive Compensation Plan in 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For each quarter of  2016, the Committee determined that each NEO and every member of senior management who received  annual base salary equal to or less than $120,000 would participate in the Executive Incentive Compensation  Plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This approach is consistent with prior years.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: FUNDING THE INCENTIVE POOL
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Company performance funds an Incentive Pool to 10% of our U.S. GAAP operating income.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation  Committee believes that setting the Incentive Pool at a fixed percentage of operating income with fluctuations  in the amounts paid directly linked to actual changes in operating income, aligns the interests of employees  and shareholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Company has never incurred an annual or quarterly operating loss since going public in September 1984.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Nonetheless, we maintain the following stringent policies in the event that we should incur no or negative  operating income for a quarter:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: No incentive payments will be made for a quarter in which we have no or negative operating income.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Any cumulative operating losses must be made up by future operating income before we would start  to fund the Incentive Pool for incentive payments.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For example, if we incurred a $5 million operating  loss in the first quarter of a fiscal year, no incentive payments would be made for that quarter.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If  operating income in the second and third quarter of such fiscal year equaled, in the aggregate,  $5 million, we would still make no incentive payments for those quarters.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: However, in the fourth  quarter, if quarterly operating income was positive, the Incentive Pool would be funded and incentive  payments would be made to eligible executives.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The foregoing policy also would apply if operating income, in years that have previously been audited  and reported, were to be subsequently adjusted downward.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In that situation, no payments under the  Executive Incentive Compensation Plan would be due until future operating income results exceed  the amount of the downward adjustment.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: However, no additional payments would be due if such  adjustments increased previously reported fiscal year operating income.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We believe this policy protects shareholder interests while strongly incentivizing our management team to  maintain and increase positive operating income every fiscal quarter.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: ALLOCATION OF THE INCENTIVE POOL
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee, at its discretion, determined each NEOs allocable portion of the Incentive Pool.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This determination was made for each fiscal quarter of 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee considered various  factors in determining each participants allocable share of the Incentive Pool, including:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Notice of Annual Meeting & Proxy Statement|27
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: COMPENSATION DISCUSSION & ANALYSIS
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The executives roles and responsibilities with the Company - generally, those executives in the most senior positions are allocated a greater portion of the Incentive Pool than those serving in less senior positions;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The contribution of the executive in increasing corporate profits and shareholder value;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: An executives promotion or noteworthy accomplishments during the fiscal year; and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The executives tenure with the Company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee re-determines each NEO, as well as other eligible senior managers allocable  share of the Incentive Pool each year.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The allocation of the Incentive Pool to NEO did not change from 2015 to  2016, except for the promotion of Dan Wall to President - Global Products.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For our most senior executives, their  allocable percentage of the Incentive Pool is likely to decline over time to accommodate additional investments  in personnel.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The allocable percentages to all senior managers (including all of the NEO) for the 2017  performance year was reduced by 6% to partially fund the expansion of our new Strategy function and related  strategic initiatives.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Determining Payouts Under the 2016 Incentive Pool
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Payouts under the Plan were determined by multiplying the Incentive Pool by each participants allocable portion  of the Incentive Pool, with the resulting earned payout subject to a payout cap (see below for further details  on the payout cap).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For each quarter of fiscal 2016, we had positive operating income, which resulted in the  funding of the Incentive Pool for each quarter.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: At the conclusion of each quarter, the Compensation Committee  reviewed and approved each NEO incentive payment under the Executive Incentive Compensation Plan based on  the executive officers allocable share of the Incentive Pool for that quarter.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Earned incentive awards were paid  subsequent to the filing of the Companys Form 10-Q or 10-K with the SEC.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In 2015 and 2016, there was a payout cap that limited the maximum payout our NEO could receive under  the Incentive Pool.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Under the cap, participants could not receive a payout that exceeded 115% of the highest  amount earned by that individual in the three prior comparable quarters.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The payout cap was not applicable in  2016, though payouts to our NEO in 2015 were capped and therefore compensation was reduced by a total of  $1,000,987 in 2015.

sentences.text: Our 2016 Stock Option Plan was designed to incentivize management to increase long-term shareholder  value and to encourage retention of key talent over a sustained time period.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For 2016, stock options were  the exclusive form of equity incentive compensation granted to our NEO, as well as to approximately 2,300  employees.

sentences.text: Realized compensation from a stock option is only achieved if the value of the Company increases  over the long term.

sentences.text: DETERMINATION OF NEO 2016 STOCK OPTION GRANTS
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee considered various factors in determining the size of each NEO stock option  grant for 2016, including:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Executive officer performance during the past 12 months, including promotions or other noteworthy  accomplishments;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Targeted NEO equity-to-overall compensation ratio;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Tenure with the Company;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Current position and associated responsibilities; and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Amount of grants relative to peers within the Company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Perquisites & Other Personal Benefits
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Company provides no perquisites or personal benefits to our NEO that are not available to all employees.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Company provides standard benefits packages to all employees that vary by country, based on individual  country regulations.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Further, the Company does not provide tax gross-ups on change in control severance  benefits or any other type of benefit.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Risk & Compensation Clawback Recovery
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Because the Executive Incentive Compensation Plan is based on cumulative operating income, any operating  losses that are incurred must be recovered from future operating income before any amounts would be due  to participants.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Since a significant portion of executive compensation comes from the Executive Incentive  Compensation Plan, the Company believes that this cumulative feature is a disincentive to excessive risk taking  by its senior managers.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: No one individual has the authority to commit the Company to excessive risk taking.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Due to the nature of the Companys services, the business has a short operating cycle.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The outcome of any  higher risk transactions, such as overriding established credit limits, would be known in a relatively short time  frame.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Management believes that when the potential impact on the bonus is considered in light of this short  operating cycle, the potential for gains that could be generated by higher risk business practices is sufficiently  mitigated.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Management believes that both the stability and the long-term growth in net revenues, operating  income and net earnings are a result of the incentives and recovery mechanism inherent in the Companys  compensation programs.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, the Company has expanded its clawback policy under the Sarbanes-Oxley Act related to  financial restatements to include not just the CEO and Chief Financial Officer (CFO), but all members of  senior management.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Notice of Annual Meeting & Proxy Statement|29

sentences.text: COMPENSATION DISCUSSION & ANALYSIS
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Role of the Compensation Committee, Management & Consultants
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Compensation decisions, other than compensation and equity grant determinations for the CEO, are made in  consultation with the CEO.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Compensation decisions for the CEO are made by our Compensation Committee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee recommends all compensation decisions for the NEO to the Board of Directors  for final approval.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: With respect to the Executive Incentive Compensation Plan, the CEO recommends  allocation percentages for all participating executive officers, which must be reviewed and approved by the  Compensation Committee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board does not believe that overall total compensation targets, per se, are consistent with the underlying  compensation philosophy of the Company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Company does recognize, however, that because it operates in  the highly competitive global logistics services industry, the quality of its service depends upon the quality of  the executives and other employees it is able to attract and retain.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In order to succeed, the Company believes  that it must be able to attract and retain qualified executives and employees.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee  considers the competitiveness of the entire compensation package of an executive officer relative to that  paid by similar companies when evaluating the adequacy of base salaries, the percentage allocations of the  Executive Incentive Compensation Plan and grants of stock options.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Companys objective is to offer  a total compensation package which gives the executive officer the opportunity to be rewarded at a level  believed to be superior to that offered by the Companys competitors in the global logistics services industry.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Company believes that the opportunity for achieving superior levels of compensation is predicated on  achieving sustained, long-term profitable results that are superior to those of its competitors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee used benchmark data on a limited basis to review base salaries and other  compensation information and practices disclosed by certain U.S. publicly traded companies in the logistics  and transportation industry.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The benchmark data has confirmed that the Companys compensation packages  offered to executives are competitive and give executives appropriate incentives to retain and gain profitable  customers and business.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Benchmark data was derived from proxy statements filed by Alaska Air Group, Inc.,  Avis Budget Group, Inc., CH Robinson Worldwide, Inc., CSX Corp., Hertz Global Holdings, Inc., Hub Group,  Inc., JB Hunt Transport Services, Inc., JetBlue Airways Corp., Landstar System, Inc., Norfolk Southern Corp.,  Ryder System, Inc., Swift Transportation, UTi Worldwide, Inc., XPO Logistics, Inc., and YRC Worldwide, Inc.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: While these companies are of various sizes in terms of revenue, the Compensation Committee believes the  benchmark data derived from this group of companies is useful for the limited comparisons described above.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In 2016, the Compensation Committee engaged Meridian Compensation Partners, LLC (Meridian) to provide  advice on executive and Director compensation matters.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee has assessed the  independence of Meridian pursuant to SEC and NASDAQ rules and determined that no conflict of interest exists  that would prevent Meridian from providing independent and objective advice to the Compensation Committee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In 2016 Meridian provided consulting services only as directed by the Compensation Committee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Meridian  reports directly to the Compensation Committee and does not provide any other services to the Company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Company has entered into employment agreements with each NEO.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Each of the employment  agreements is automatically renewable upon expiration for additional one-year periods unless either party  elects otherwise.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Executive Stock Ownership Policy
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Company maintains executive stock ownership guidelines.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: These stock ownership guidelines are  applicable to our NEO, and other certain other senior management holding a title of Senior Vice President or  above.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: These guidelines are designed to increase executives equity stakes in the Company and to further align executives interests with those of shareholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The guidelines require covered executives to own shares of  the Companys Common Stock sufficient to satisfy the amount specified below as a multiple of the executives  annual base salary:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Chief Executive Officer 15 x Base Salary Currently $ 1,500,000 President or Executive Vice President 10 x Base Salary Currently $ 1,000,000 Senior Vice President 5 x Base Salary Currently $ 500,000
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Executives in the positions above need to achieve the corresponding ownership target within five years of  promotion to the position or within five years of the policy adoption date.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This policy excludes stock option  grants from the ownership calculation and is governed by the Compensation Committee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As of December 31,  2016 all of our NEO are in compliance with their respective ownership guideline.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A policy change effective in 2017 requires that all executives hold 75% of the net after-tax shares received upon vesting of any PSUs and RSUs until their respective stock ownership guidelines are achieved.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Insider Trading Policy Prohibits Hedging or Pledging
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Companys Insider Trading Policy prohibits its Board of Directors and employees from hedging or  pledging their ownership of Company stock, including trading in publicly-traded options, puts, calls or other  derivative instruments related to Company stock.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Other Retirement or Disability Payments
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Company has no formal obligations to make any payments to any executive officer upon his or her  death, disability or retirement except to executive officers domiciled in countries where statutory regulation  require that these benefits be provided to all employees.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Company adopted a policy in 2014 that  prohibits the payment of any retirement bonuses to executive officers and members of senior management.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: While there is no legal or contractual obligation to do so, the Company has, on occasion, accelerated the  vesting of any unvested stock options of employees who pass away.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Potential Payments upon Termination & Change in Control
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Stock options granted to employees including the NEO, will become immediately vested and fully exercisable  in connection with the occurrence of a Change in Control of the Company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Change in Control means  either of the following:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (a) when any person (with certain exceptions) becomes the beneficial owner, directly  or indirectly, of 50% of the Companys then outstanding securities, or
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (b) when a transaction requiring  shareholder approval occurs involving the sale of all, or substantially all, of the assets of the Company or a  merger of the Company with or into another company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The employment agreement for each NEO contains a covenant not to compete which allows the Company  to extend the restriction on competition with the Company for six months following termination of the  employment relationship.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The extension is at the sole discretion of the Company unless the employee  terminates the employment relationship by resigning during a specified period surrounding a change in  control, in which case the employee may decline any accompanying lump sum payment and thereby avoid the  accompanying restriction on competition.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Scenario 1: No changes are made in management as a result of a change in control as described above.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: NEO would receive the realized gain on exercise, if any, upon acceleration of unvested stock options shown in Column 1.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Scenario 2: NEO employment agreements are terminated with cause subsequent to a change in control.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Amounts due would include the realized gain on exercise, if any, upon acceleration of unvested stock options  under Column
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 1. No amounts are due to the NEO under Column
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 2. At the Companys discretion, as noted  above, for a lump sum payment of half the NEO base salary under Column 3, the Company could invoke the  non-compete provisions contained in the employment agreement.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Scenario 3: NEO resigns subsequent to a change in control.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The NEO would be entitled to the realized gain on  exercise, if any, upon acceleration of unvested stock options under Column 1.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The NEO would not be entitled  to any cash compensation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Company could, in its sole discretion, pay the NEO a lump sum amount under  Column 3 in exchange for invoking the non-compete provisions in the employment agreement.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In a change  in control situation, the NEO has the option to reject or to accept this lump sum payment.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: By rejecting the  payment, the executive will no longer be subject to the non-compete provisions of the employment agreement.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Scenario 4: NEO employment agreements are terminated without cause subsequent to the change in control.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Amounts due would include the realized gain on exercise, if any, upon acceleration of unvested stock options  shown in Column 1.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, the NEO would be entitled to receive cash compensation based on one-half of  base salary plus one-half of the amount of the Bonus Pool payment received by the executive in the preceding  twelve months under Column 4.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Under the terms of the employment agreement, when an executive is terminated  without cause, the non-compete provisions remain in effect for six months from the date of termination.

sentences.text: Policy on Deductibility of Compensation
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Under Section 162(m) of the Code, the Federal income tax deduction for certain types of compensation paid  to each of our NEO (except our CFO) is limited to $1,000,000 per taxable year unless such compensation  meets certain requirements.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee intends to take into account the deduction  limitation under Code Section 162(m) when developing compensation programs and seek to qualify incentive  compensation under 162(m) to the extent possible.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: However, in order to maintain flexibility and structure a  compensation program that is in the best interest of our company, the Committee has not adopted a policy  requiring all compensation to be fully deductible under Section 162(m).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee  may determine it is in the best interest of the Company to award compensation to a NEO which is not fully  deductible as a result of this limitation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In accordance with Section 951 of the Dodd-Frank Wall Street Reform and Consumer Protection Act and  Section 14A of the Securities and Exchange Act of 1934, as amended, the Company is required to submit to  shareholders a non-binding vote to advise whether the non-binding shareholder vote on compensation of the  Companys NEO shall occur every one, two, or three years.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board of Directors believes that submitting the non-binding vote on compensation of the Companys NEO  to shareholders on an annual basis is appropriate for the Company and its shareholders at this time.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In 2011, the last time this advisory proposal was put before shareholders, 86% percent of voting shareholders  chose a frequency of one year.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The proxy card provides shareholders with four choices (every 1 Year, 2 Years, 3 Years, or Abstain).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Shareholders are not voting to approve or disapprove the Board of Directors recommendation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Effect of Proposal
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The frequency vote is non-binding.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Shareholder approval of a one-, two-, or three-year frequency vote will not  require the Company to implement the non-binding vote on compensation of the Companys NEO every one, two,  or three years.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The final decision on the frequency of a non-binding vote on compensation of the Companys NEO  remains with the Board of Directors and/or its committees.

sentences.text: The Board of Directors values the opinions of the Companys shareholders.
